TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed WSFederationHttpSecurityMode extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies the different security modes for .

remarks.format:
## Remarks This enumeration defines the security modes that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpBinding> supports.
## Examples The following code shows how to set <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurity.Mode%2A> to a member of this enumeration.
[!code-vb[WSFederationHttpSecurity#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.servicemodel.ws_3_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WSFederationHttpSecurity#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.servicemodel.ws_3_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode Message = int32(1)

Docs.summary: Integrity, confidentiality, server authentication and client authentication are provided using SOAP message security. By default, the body is encrypted and signed. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode None = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The SOAP message is not secure during transfer. No Security Token Service is contacted. This mode is equivalent to using the binding with .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode TransportWithMessageCredential = int32(2)

Docs.summary: Integrity, confidentiality and server authentication are provided by HTTPS. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is provided by means of SOAP message security and is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.
